citation.article-title: Taxonomic rearrangements of the genera Thiocapsa and Amoebobacter on the basis of 16S rDNA sequence analyses, and description of Thiolamprovum gen. nov.

p.s: Emended description of the genus Amoebobacter
Amoebobacter (A.moe.bo.bac’ter. Gr. n. amoebe change, transformation; M.L. n. bacter a rod; M.L. masc. n. Amoebobacter changeable rod)
Cells are nearly spherical to oval, 1.9-3-8 x 2.0-4.5 µm in size, may occur in irregular aggregates of up to 40 cells, multiplication by binary fission, non-motile, Gram-negative.
Internal photosynthetic membrane system of vesicular type containing the photosynthetic pigments bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids.
Phototrophic under anoxic conditions in the light, may be chemoautotrophic or mixotrophic under micro-oxic conditions in the dark.

Capable of photolithoautotrophic growth with sulfide, thiosulfate and elemental sulfur as electron donor, elemental sulfur globules are transiently stored inside the cells, final oxidation product is sulfate.
The G + C content of the DNA is 63.4-64.1 mol% (Bd).
